channel.title: Tables
channel.description: Tables are bad. Do not use them. If you're a proffessional, you ONLY use div's.

item.title: Tables
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Tables are elements that arrange information in a tabulated form while divs are block elements; by default, multiple divs in a row will show up one on top of the other on the screen, but with CSS you can manage layouts with divs much more easily and better. The main difference when it comes to web design is thatdivs were designed for use when layout out a website while tables were not.

Read full topic

item.title: Tables
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

S!ms: I hope you mean that it doesn't support CSS and not that it doesn't support divs entirely, because that would be quite stupid on the part of Sony. Why would they try and reverse the transition of web interfaces for mobile units to standard conformity?

Div is a standard html element and as pplsuqbawlz said, if they are not formatted with css they just form a standard flowing layout. I have a hard time believing that PSP does not support them.

Read full topic

item.title: Tables
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Friday13th:

I dont agee with that one. If You make a website You have to use tables. Look at the template of this forum. Everything is made in tables

I agree with you to some extent, but it's not absolutely necessary to use tables at all...it would be harder, but it would be possible rewrite this forum to use only divs. Tables were originally made primarily for structuring data if needed, just like you would sometimes use a table in a word processer, but as they were much easier to use to lay out websites, they just became overused. Now since CSS is spread and expanded a lot more, it's easier to design a site using only block elements and no tables, which follows the w3 standards.

Tables aren't terrible though...I mean, if you're just throwing a site together, who cares if you use table or divs? A majority of people who will visit your site won't care one way or another.

But I still think that, to the web development community, using divs does not make you look more professional, but shows that you're not so lazy that you have to resort to using tables than sticking to standards which won't take you that much longer.

Read full topic
